title: Public Service Commission Candidate Open Forum
description:
As temperatures heat up and power bills rise, frustrated Georgians are starting to look at the Public Service Commission (PSC) for new regulations and to potentially bust up a Georgia Power monopoly.  Statewide PSC primaries for seats in Districts 2 and 3 will be held on June 17 and the general election will be on November 4.

Coastal Georgia for Democracy, the Savannah Indivisible group for Georgia District 1, will host a live open forum for voters to ask the candidates questions about their positions in advance of the election. The event will be held at the Coastal Georgia Center, 305 Fahm Street, Savannah, on June 12 at 6:00pm.  The free event is open to the public.

All PSC candidates have been invited to appear and will answer voters’ questions regarding anything under the purview of the Public Service Commission, which includes how much Georgia residents pay for their electricity, landline telephones, and natural gas.  They also oversee the 811 “Call before you dig” line and items related to line interruptions when they are improperly monitored by contractors and residents. 

Confirmed attendees for the candidate forum include Alicia Blackstone in District 2 and Daniel Blackman, Peter Hubbard, Robert Jones, and Keisha Sean Waites in District 3.
 
The Georgia Public Service Commission has exclusive power to decide what are fair and reasonable rates for services under its jurisdiction. They must balance Georgia citizens' need for reliable services and reasonable rates with the need for utilities to earn a reasonable return on investment while not guaranteeing it. The Commission protects consumers' interests while abiding by legal standards in setting rates. All matters scheduled for public hearing are heard by the Commissioners or in special cases, by an appointed hearing officer in open session.

Coastal Georgia for Democracy, a grassroots group of residents in the coastal Georgia region, is Savannah’s Indivisible group in Georgia’s District 1. We are committed to protecting democracy and promoting genuine equity and inclusion through progressive advocacy. We do not endorse candidates. We aim to defend and protect against attacks on constitutionally guaranteed freedoms, including safe and fair elections and the voting rights of citizens. To learn more, visit us at https://www.coastaldemocracy.org.

description:

Eric is proudly endorsed by Working Families Party, NextUP, Basic Rights Oregon, Northwest Oregon Labor Council, United Food and Commercial Workers, Oregon School Employees Association, Beaverton Education Association, Oregon Education Association, Pineros Y Campesinos Unidos del Noroeste, and Washington County's Ignite.

Eric has the support of other community leaders such asTammy Carpenter, Beaverton School District Board Director, State Representative Lesly Muñoz, State Representative Farrah Chaichi, THPRD President Barbie Minor, and Assistant Principal Aarti Ramkrishna.

title: Talk/Leaflet constituents of Rep. Lawler [NY17] about Tax Scam/Medicaid Cut budget
description:
Leaflet and talk with constituents of [R] Rep. Lawler in Tarrytown, in the purple district of NY17 about the very unpopular budget/reconciliation bill that would cut trillions from Medicaid, and much more so that billionaires could get trillions in tax cuts. If Rep. Lawler gets lots of calls telling him to vote against this budget bill, it is possible to defeat it. The Republicans majority in the House is so small that the loss of Lawler's vote could kill it. We'll be meeting at Grand Central Station [information kiosk] at 9:30am to take a Metro North train to Tarrytown [arriving at 10:39am].  We'll have leaflets and wear signs "No Cuts to Medicaid" and "Billionaires Do Not Need Tax Cuts". We'll be approaching people in high traffic areas with leaflets and talk to them about this Tax Scam budget, urge them to phone Rep. Lawler and tell them about local actions planned by local groups that we work with.



Swing Left is a grassroots organization that helps people make an impact in the elections that determine the national balance of power in the country. Our goal is simple: elect Democrats to help strengthen our democracy.
accessibility_notes:
If you're coming by train meet us in Grand Central Station at the information kiosk at 9:30 [we're taking the 9:50am train].
If you are driving to Tarrytown please meet us at the train station at 10:39am.  You'll get a further orientation and the materials there.

title: Join Society of St. Andrew for a Potato Glean in Hastings, FL🌾✨

address_lines: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
Let’s fight hunger and food waste—together.

Join us for a Society of St. Andrew Gleaning Event, where we’ll sort and bag surplus potatoes for families in need. It’s a hands-on way to give back, enjoy the outdoors, and share in meaningful community service.

This event takes place in a shaded area and is perfect for participants who struggle with mobility limitations. You are welcome to bring a chair if you need. Tasks will include sorting and bagging potatoes that have already been picked and gleaned from the field.

📅 Date: May 6th, 13th, 20th 2025
⏰ Time: 9 AM – 12 PM
📍 Location: Provided upon registration

🌱 What to Bring:

✅ Closed-toe shoes (required)

✅ Comfortable clothing that can get messy

✅ Hat, sunscreen, and gloves (optional but helpful)

✅ A reusable water bottle to stay hydrated

📢 RSVP or Questions? 
Contact:
Megan McEwen
📞 (863) 224-0403
📧 fl-glean@endhunger.org

### Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

#### 1. What is gleaning?

- Gleaning is collecting leftover crops from farms that would otherwise go to waste. These fresh fruits and vegetables are then donated to food banks and hunger relief groups.

#### 2. Who can attend?

- All are welcome—no prior experience needed! Perfect for families, small groups, or anyone looking to serve. (Kids must be with an adult.)

#### 3. Are tools provided?
- Yes! We’ll supply any tools and bags you’ll need to glean.

#### 4. What if it rains?

- We’ll monitor the weather and let you know if anything changes. Safety first!

#### 5. Where does the food go?

- All the produce goes directly to local food banks and community partners feeding those in need.

#### 6. How can I stay in the loop?

- For event updates, visit: https://www.mobilize.us/endhunger/

#### 7. Other FAQs : 

- NO smoking, NO pets,

title: 📍State of the People Power Tour — Richmond, VA 📢 SIGN UP TODAY
description:
# 📍 **State of the People Power Tour — Richmond, VA 📢 SIGN UP TODAY**

---

## ✨ Meet us in Richmond for the next stop of the State of the People Power Tour!

We’re building a national movement — one city at a time — and **Richmond is next**. Join us for two powerful days of healing, service, strategy, and action — rooted in faith, justice, and the leadership of our people.

---

## ✅ What You Need to Do

**Step 1:** You’ve signed up with us here on Mobilize — thank you!  
**Step 2:** ✍🏽 You MUST complete your RSVP at **[stateoftheppl.com/events](https://stateoftheppl.com/events)** and select **Richmond** to receive the **location, full schedule, and workshop access** for your city.

---

Join **LIVE FREE USA** and the **BLACK CHURCH FREEDOM FUND** in **Richmond** for the **State of the People Power Tour** — a two-day experience to reimagine public safety, activate faith and civic leaders, and build collective power rooted in justice, healing, and hope.

We’re building a national movement — one city at a time — and it starts with *you*.

---

## ✊🏾 Why We’re Coming to Richmond

This stop will bring together **faith leaders, justice-impacted individuals, youth, and community members** to organize around:

- **Community Violence Intervention (CVI)** and community-led safety  
- **Church-based organizing** for justice and healing  
- **Mental health, housing, and economic empowerment**  
- **Public policy rooted in care, not punishment**

---

## 🗓️ What to Expect

### 🔥 DAY 1 — Relief & Resilience  
_Presented with 501(c)(3) partners_

- Mutual aid, wellness stations, food & clothing support  
- Listening Town Hall with local youth and organizers  
- Field Hearing with elected officials

### ✊🏽 DAY 2 — Day of Action  
_Powered by movement partners_

- Hands-on workshops: tenants’ rights, healing justice, CVI, grassroots power  
- Community Impact Fair: voter reg, job tools, business support  
- **SOTP Power Rally** — high-energy gathering to cast a shared vision

---

## 📲 Stay Connected

Follow [**@StateOfThePpl**](https://instagram.com/stateoftheppl) for real-time updates and tour highlights.

Let’s build something powerful — together.

title: 📍State of the People Power Tour — Jackson, MS 📢 SIGN UP TODAY
description:
# 📍 **State of the People Power Tour — Jackson, MS 📢 SIGN UP TODAY**

---

## ✨ Meet us in Jackson for the next stop of the State of the People Power Tour!

We’re building a national movement — one city at a time — and **Jackson is next**. Join us for two powerful days of healing, service, strategy, and action — rooted in faith, justice, and the leadership of our people.

---

## ✅ What You Need to Do

**Step 1:** You’ve signed up with us here on Mobilize — thank you!  
**Step 2:** ✍🏽 You MUST complete your RSVP at **[stateoftheppl.com/events](https://stateoftheppl.com/events)** and select **Jackson** to receive the **location, full schedule, and workshop access** for your city.

---

Join **LIVE FREE USA** and the **BLACK CHURCH FREEDOM FUND** in **Jackson** for the **State of the People Power Tour** — a two-day experience to reimagine public safety, activate faith and civic leaders, and build collective power rooted in justice, healing, and hope.

We’re building a national movement — one city at a time — and it starts with *you*.

---

## ✊🏾 Why We’re Coming to Jackson

This stop will bring together **faith leaders, justice-impacted individuals, youth, and community members** to organize around:

- **Community Violence Intervention (CVI)** and community-led safety  
- **Church-based organizing** for justice and healing  
- **Mental health, housing, and economic empowerment**  
- **Public policy rooted in care, not punishment**

---

## 🗓️ What to Expect

### 🔥 DAY 1 — Relief & Resilience  
_Presented with 501(c)(3) partners_

- Mutual aid, wellness stations, food & clothing support  
- Listening Town Hall with local youth and organizers  
- Field Hearing with elected officials

### ✊🏽 DAY 2 — Day of Action  
_Powered by movement partners_

- Hands-on workshops: tenants’ rights, healing justice, CVI, grassroots power  
- Community Impact Fair: voter reg, job tools, business support  
- **SOTP Power Rally** — high-energy gathering to cast a shared vision

---

## 📲 Stay Connected

Follow [**@StateOfThePpl**](https://instagram.com/stateoftheppl) for real-time updates and tour highlights.

Let’s build something powerful — together.

We will provide training, all the supplies you'll need, snacks, water and lots of cheerleading!

title: Creative Resistance Brainstorm
description:
What do signs, stickers, street theatre, and Chinese fortune cookies have in common?  They are all ways we can fight fear with fun at the Pride for the People rally.  

Join us on May 15th to brainstorm ideas inspired by the Serbian resistance group, Otpor.  [Why we should do more, laugh more](https://grassrootsconnector.substack.com/p/why-we-should-do-more-laugh-more). After the brainstorm, Swing Blue Alliance will take the best ideas and bring them to life!

_Against the assault of laughter nothing can stand._ — Mark Twain

description:

  This is a non partisan event with the goal of raising awareness of kindness towards fellow humans. We strongly support kindness and love towards all people.
 Bring a sign to wave and a positive attitude. We look forward to seeing you there.

title: NY-17 Constituents Fight Back
description:
## Rally To Support Emily Feiner, Oppose Mike Lawler’s Efforts to Silence Dissent

This past weekend, NY-17 constituent and social worker Emily Feiner was forcibly removed from a town hall held by Rep. Mike Lawler, along with Jennifer Cabrera, an NY-17 constituent and chair of the Westchester-Putnam Chapter of the Working Families Party. In response to this incident, and other attempts to silence constituents, hundreds of NY-17 constituents will be rallying in Nyack to support Emily and other targets of Lawler’s intimidation, stand up for the Constitution, and highlight efforts by progressives to fight back against Rep. Lawler and Donald Trump’s authoritarianism.

Join us to hear from Emily Feiner and Jennifer Cabrera, Westchester-Putnam Working Families Party Chair!

title: As You Are!
description:
When times are tough, we need to take care of ourselves and prepare for the road ahead. So, you are invited to an informal self-care and strategy huddle! Please join us at AS YOU ARE on May 15th.

In the spirit of self-care, this event is more like a slumber party so wear comfortable clothing! We'll provide a bunch of self-care goodies, like snacks, nail polish, face masks, temporary tattoos, and other little things to bring you some joy. And maybe bring a notebook to jot down some ideas and plans for what we as a movement should start doing next.

title: Third Avenue Bike and Walk
description:
Join the Bronx/Uptown and Manhattan Activist Committees to explore Third Avenue! We will start at 11am at Third Ave and 62nd Street, by the Citibike station. We will grab Citibikes and ride the green wave north on Third Avenue. We will explore the impact of the Third Avenue redesign. We will dock the bikes on Third Avenue and 100th Street, where we will continue on foot to explore the portion of Third Ave that has not been redesigned. 

NYC DOT has a plan to convert Third Avenue into a complete street above 96th Street. Do they have the plan right? We will stop a key spots on Third Ave in East Harlem to talk about the particular needs of the neighborhood, why infrastructure projects look different past 96th Street, and note what we want to see. 

See you there!

title: Win Elections, Rebuild Democracy with Brooklyn Opposition

address_lines: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
The chaos fueled by Trump’s authoritarian ambitions and Musk’s reckless influence can make the future feel bleak. But we’re not powerless and the numbers show just how close we are to taking back control. 

In 2024, Democrats lost the House by 3 seats and just 7,309 votes total—the narrowest House majority in almost 100 years. 

**With such a narrow margin, winning the House is doable.** And it’s also the most impactful thing we can do to halt the destructive Trump, Musk, and Project 2025 agenda. While calling Congress and supporting lawsuits help to slow the bleeding, only elections will remove them from office. A House victory will give Democrats a critical federal lever: more power and more oversight to investigate government actions and political corruption, effectively stopping the MAGA legislative agenda in its tracks.

Working together, we can take a critical first step toward rebuilding democracy. **Join our gathering to connect, commiserate, and conspire– we’ll learn more about Swing Left’s strategy and make a plan to take action together.**

title: Certification of North Carolina Supreme Court Justice Allison Riggs
description:
More than six months ago, Justice Allison Riggs won re-election to her Supreme Court seat. Now, after millions of dollars spent, thousands of volunteer hours, and more than 68,000 voters’ ballots put at risk of being thrown out, her victory was affirmed by a Trump-appointed judge in federal court and her opponent finally conceded.

Join us for Justice Riggs’ certification with Justice Anita Earls to celebrate this victory for North Carolina voters and the rule of law.

title: Canvassing to Win: 10,000 Doors for Omar Fateh

address_lines: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
## Knocking doors is the best tool we have to win the city we deserve. 
### We need to be the best canvassers each of us can be.

This training will equip you to be excellent and confident canvassers on the doors.  If you are totally new to canvassing and it freaks you out, or an experienced canvasser who wants to sharpen your tools, ***this training is for you.*** 
 
- Best practices for approaching neighbors and having relational, effective conversations
- Skills to stay grounded on the doors
- Deep Canvassing tools to connect with and persuade voters
- The art of knocking the door

In a harsh federal landscape, we're fighting for the city we deserve by ***electing Omar Fateh as mayor of Minneapolis*** and sending our progressive majority back to the city council. We need our elected officials to be a line of defense against the GOP agenda, and we need them fighting for a progressive vision for our city.

## We have each other: let's go get more of us. 

We know knocking doors for the first time can be nerve-wracking. It's also our most important practice to earn votes to win! That's why we are building community and practicing skills, together! 

## We will win this one conversation at a time!

title: Workers' Block Party
description:
### Celebrate Worker Power with Food, Music & Joy!

Join us on Tuesday, May 13 at 3 PM in Denver (exact location TBD) for the **Workers’ Block Party**, a celebration of the strength, solidarity, and unstoppable momentum of working people across Colorado!

This isn’t just a party, it’s a show of power. As we come together with music, food, and community joy, we’re also raising our voices to demand real action for worker rights. We’ll be calling on Governor Jared Polis to side with working families -- not corporate profits -- by standing firmly with us in support of strong unions, higher wages, and dignity on the job.

What to expect:

- Live music and entertainment from the Mike Maurer Band
- Food, drinks, and cake!
- A powerful call to action for worker justice in Colorado

Bring your signs and your voice. Let’s celebrate how far we’ve come, and remind our elected officials that we’re not backing down.

title: West Branch-Lyco Coffee Hour: Morning Buzz!
description:
**Join West Branch Action Together for our first Lycoming County coffee hour!**


We’re so excited to invite you to Morning Buzz, our new coffee get-together for the West Branch chapter of Action Together! Action is the antidote, and it takes lots of different forms. Take this opportunity to check in, share how you’re doing, and find out how you can take action right now. We’ll be meeting at Buzzsaw Coffee in the Pajama Factory from 11am-1pm, so come for a quick cup of coffee or stay the whole time!

This is a great opportunity to connect with folks in your community who are looking for ways to get involved  - please feel free to bring a friend or two who could use a supportive progressive community right now!


*Please note: this is our first coffee/social event on the schedule for the West Branch chapter, and it’s in Lycoming County. We hope to get more scheduled in the other counties, so if you have suggestions for places where we can come together and build community while finding ways to make change, please email Community Organizer Rob Barkley at rob@actiontogethernepa.org

title: 2025 Post-Session Volunteer Celebration
description:
2025 Post-Session Volunteer Celebration & Community Event

Hosted at Villain Theater during DOLL STARS: Miami’s Girliest Drag Show & Viewing Party Extravaganza 

Come celebrate you, our incredible volunteers and community champions.

After a powerful legislative session, it's time to unwind, connect, and honor the folks who made it all possible. Join us for a night of gratitude, joy, and fierce performances with the cast of Doll LinkUp: Linerbaddie, Ariesela, Opal Am Rah, The Angel Nova, and special guests.

What to Expect:
Volunteer Appreciation Mixer

RuPaul’s Drag Race All Stars Season 10 Viewing Party

Trans-Centered Drag Show & Open Stage

Shout-outs, Photos, and Community Connection

Date: Friday, May 9th, 2025
Doors Open: 7:30 PM
Show Starts: 8:00 PM
Location: Villain Theater, 5865 NE 2nd Ave, Miami, FL 33137
Free Parking Available

Why Sign Up?
This event is our way of saying thank you. Your time, voice, and commitment helped drive change during the legislative session. Join us to celebrate your impact, connect with community, and enjoy an unforgettable evening.

Open Stage sign-up is available on Instagram: @dolllinkup

Funding for Doll LinkUp is supported by the Ellie’s Oolite Arts Awards and our nonprofit partners, who also serve the community weekly in the Villain Theater lobby.

For questions, contact Equality Florida Miami Dade Community Organizer MariaVictoria Chacon-Briceño at MariaVictoria@equalityflorida.org

title: NO KINGS - Flagstaff, AZ
description:
In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings. NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.

🚨On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.🚨

The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.

On June 14th, we’re showing up everywhere he isn’t—to say no thrones, no crowns, no kings. Check out nokings.org for more information.

A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values.

This is Indivisible Northern AZ's LOCAL event page, which is meant to reach people who have registered for one of our other events.  We are also registered on the NoKing.org website so that anyone can find this event on the map.  It is the SAME EVENT and you only need to register on one or the other links.
You will find more local details on this link.
Co-sponsors of our local event will be announced soon and listed here.

title: Pack City Hall for Safe Healthy Homes Act Vote!
description:
Pack City Hall on Tuesday June 3rd for the Housing Committee hearing where they will VOTE YES on the Safe Healthy Homes bills!

When: Tuesday June 3rd 9am

Where: City Hall 4th Floor!

What: City Council Housing Committee hearing on June 3rd to vote on the Safe Healthy Homes Act, 3 bills that strengthen renters rights by giving the City the power to proactively inspect rental units, hold bad landlords accountable when they violate the code, and ensure protections for renters against retaliation.

Why: We have a housing safety crisis in our city.  Hundreds of renters are going without heat in winter or living with mold, leaks, infestations, fire hazards, or other dangerous conditions that are affecting our health and even taking lives. We need City Council to PROTECT renters! We need YOU and every person who can make it to show up to make sure Council passes these bills,

JOIN US to show City Council that you want them to VOTE YES to protect renters! 


**EMAIL YOUR COUNCILMEMBER NOW: bit.ly/safehealthyhomes

title: SAVE OUR SAY: St. Louis Sit-In | Hands Around The Arch
description:
Respect MO Voters and 50501 STL invite you to our SAVE OUR SAY Sit-In at the Gateway Arch. As Missouri legislators return home after undermining voter-approved amendments, we will gather to demand that our voices be heard and respected.

For over a century, Missourians have relied on the citizen initiative process to shape our state's laws. That process is now under attack.
In April, Governor Kehoe signed SB22, also known as the "Let Politicians Lie Act.” This bill guts the initiative process, making it nearly impossible for everyday citizens to put measures on the ballot without political interference.

We are rallying to protect our democracy and support a proposed 2026 amendment that would:
1-Ban politicians from overturning voter-approved amendments
2-Protect the initiative process from added barriers
3-Stop misleading ballot language that manipulates voters

Together, we will send a clear message: We, the people, have the final say.

Event Highlights

 ✨ Guest Speakers

 ✨ Petitions, voter registration, calls & letters

 ✨ “Hands Around the Arch” – Circle of Unity

 ✨ Family-friendly and peaceful

 Bring: Signs, voice, water, snacks, chair/blanket, and comfortable shoes.

 Meet: In the grassy field under the Arch, river-facing side.

 Parking: Nearby garages and street parking available.

 Note: Please do not block or congregate on sidewalks.

title: Democracy In Action: Medicaid Cuts Affect Us All, It's Time to Act

sponsor.name: League of Women Voters of Kentucky

description:
Proposed cuts to Medicaid will profoundly affect Kentuckians. Medicaid provides cradle-to-grave health care to Kentuckians, as well as community care for individuals with disabilities. It not only provides physical and mental health, but also economic health to providers, facilities and supporting businesses.
 Currently, 1.5 million Kentuckians–one third of all Kentuckians are covered by Medicaid. The cuts could result in the loss of coverage to 450,000 Kentuckians, at an economic loss of 3.8 billion dollars. What will happen to the services that cover:
Low- and moderate-income children and parents 
Other low-income adults 
Aged, blind, and disabled – including those with serious mental illness and developmental disabilities 
Elderly and disabled who require long-term care

Learn about these cuts and their impact from these leaders:
Priscilla Easterling, Director of Outreach & Enrollment, KY Voices for Health
Dr. Bart Erwin, CEO, Family Health Centers
Mary Haynes, CEO & President, Advocacy Action Network
 
Dr. Sheila Schuster, Executive Director, Advocacy Action Network, will give a call to action.

title: NO KINGS Indivisible El Dorado County CA #4
description:
## In America, we don’t put up with wanna-be kings!

NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.

On Saturday, June 14, Americans are taking to the streets nationwide. 

In El Dorado County, CA, were rising up (literally) in a coordinated, multi-location, mass demonstration!

10 OVERPASSES  • 16 MILES • 1 MESSAGE 

Join us along Route 50 from Cameron Park to Placerville. Choose which overpass or pedestrian bridge you will rise up on to say: NO KINGS RULING OVER US!

There are 10 different registration links for the locations shown below. This is registration link # 4 for the overpass at Missouri Flat Rd. Park in the Park and Ride lot on the south side of Hwy 50 or the Target shopping center.

The others can also be found on Mobilize. Sign up for the one you’ll go to:

1.  Cameron Park - Cambridge Rd
2.  Shingle Springs - Ponderosa Rd. 
3.  Diamond Springs/Placerville - EL Dorado Rd. 
**strong text**4.  Placerville - Missouri Flat Rd. *
5.  Placerville - Placerville Dr. / Forni Dr. 
6.  Placerville - Ray Lawyer Dr 
7.  Placerville - Pedestrian Bridge West 
8.  Placerville  - Pedestrian Bridge East 
9.  Placerville - Carson Rd 
10.  Almost Apple Hill - El Dorado Trail Pedestrian/Bike Bridge (some hiking required).

The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.

On June 14th, we’re showing up everywhere he isn’t—to say no thrones, no crowns, no kings.
Check out nokings.org for more information.

*A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values.*

title: Multnomah County Democrats + SOLVE Hollywood Cleanup
description:
The Multnomah County Democrats Community Action & Engagement Committee and House District 45 are combining forces to join a SOLVE cleanup in the Hollywood Neighborhood from 11am-1pm on Saturday, May 17th. 

Let's all work together to make our community more beautiful!

To join this event please signup here on Mobilize AND at the SOLVE event page below: 

https://volunteer.solveoregon.org/opportunity/a0CVL00001tpVke2AE/hollywood-neighborhood-cleanup

More info from SOLVE:

Meeting Location: Laughing Planet's Hollywood location is on NE 42nd Ave just north of NE Sandy Blvd.

Address: 1914 Northeast 42nd Avenue Portland, OR 97213 | Map Link

What to Bring: Please wear closed-toed shoes and weather-appropriate clothing, and bring a backpack for hands-free convenience. Feel free to bring your personal tools if available and a reusable water bottle to support our sustainability efforts.

What's Provided: Trash grabbers and bags, gloves, and vests will be provided.

Restrooms: No public restrooms are available

Parking: On-street parking in the area should be easy to find. As a courtesy to our host, Laughing Planet, please don't park in their small lot!

Transit: The Hollywood Transit Center is a short walk away, and Trimet bus service makes several stops in the area.

Accessibility: This area is accessible for folks with mobility concerns.

title: Pasco Resists- Democracy is Worth Fighting For
description:
A growing coalition of concerned citizens from across Pasco County-Pasco Resists- will gather on Friday, May 23, 2025, from 4:00-6:00PM at the West Pasco Government Center (8731 Citizens Dr, New Port Richey) to protest the erosion of democracy and honor America’s veterans in advance of Memorial Day.

The peaceful protest, titled “Democracy is Worth Fighting For,” will spotlight the ongoing dismissal and silencing of federal workers from critical agencies including the FAA, CDC, NIH, NIOSH, Veteran Affairs, Department of Education, HHS, IRS, FEMA, CFPB, USPS, NOAA, and USAID. Organizers argue that these actions represent a dangerous authoritarian turn in federal governance.

“Veterans gave everything to defend our democracy, not to watch it be handed over to billionaires and felons who care more about profit and power than people,” said Doris Carroll, a retired nurse and community organizer. “We’re calling on everyday Americans to wake up, speak out, and stand up for the values this country was built on.”

Participants will carry signs, hear from guest speakers—including veterans, nurses, and civic leaders—and engage in a symbolic tribute to those who served in the U.S. Armed Forces. The event also condemns recent policy decisions that weaken environmental protections, public health infrastructure, and civil service integrity.

This protest is part of a wider movement that began in February, as citizens across the state and nation unite to oppose what organizers are calling a “bro-ligarchy”—a consolidation of power among wealthy elites that threatens the rule of law and constitutional governance.

title: No Kings in America - Talkeetna, Alaska
description:
In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings. NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.

🚨On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.🚨

The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.

On June 14th, we’re showing up everywhere he isn’t—to say no thrones, no crowns, no kings. Check out www.nokings.org for more information.

A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values.

Through nonviolence, courage displaces fear; love transforms hate. Acceptance dissipates prejudice; hopes ends despair. Peace dominates war; faith reconciles doubt. Mutual regard cancels enmity.

Come for the community connection - Everyone is welcome!

title: Minnetonka Wednesday Weekly Protest

address_lines: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
Our Minnetonka Wednesday Weekly Protest event is a peaceful, legal, nonviolent, family-friendly expression of first amendment rights. We will gather on the public sidewalks and grassy banks along the road margins at the intersection of Minnesota State Highway 7 and County Road 101 in Minnetonka where we will display our hand-made signs in view of evening rush hour traffic at a busy intersection. The convener is experienced in protesting at this location in all kinds of weather. The Highway 7 corridor includes communities with some of the highest voter turnout and civic engagement in the entire country. Residents here span the whole political spectrum of the United States of America, but we all agree that there are no kings in America. In between elections, we remind elected officials that no one is above the law and every elected official is accountable to the people under the Constitution. We affirm that American values of democracy, freedom, and rule of law and opposition to Trump's unaffordable policies are broadly supported in our community. 

The Wednesday 14 May 2025 event is the second in a planned long series of Minnetonka Wednesday Weekly Protest events that will continue indefinitely on each Wednesday afternoon through summer, autumn, winter, and into next year as needed until further notice.

title: 📢Fair School Funding Town Hall - Big Walnut
description:
**Title:** Fair School Funding Town Hall 
**Description:**

Join us for a virtual town hall where we'll fight for the schools all our kids deserve!h

We believe that every child, regardless of their race or family's income, has the right to a quality education that opens doors to their dreams. But for too long, Ohio's school funding system has fallen short, creating an uneven playing field where some kids get more opportunities than others.

This isn't just about numbers; it's about justice. When we underfund our schools, it harms students, their families, and our community.  It denies them the resources students need to thrive and have access to all the opportunities they deserve. 

At this town hall, we will:

* **Learn** how state funding decisions are impacting our schools. 
* **Expose** how the current system perpetuates educational and economic disparities.
* **Share** to tell our stories.
* **Organize** to build a powerful movement of parents, students, and community members who won't settle for anything less than equity.

It's time to rewrite the narrative. Let's demand that our lawmakers fully fund the Fair School Funding Plan, a solution that takes into account the actual needs of each district.  Our kids are counting on us to build a future where their zip code doesn't determine their destiny.

title: Meta Peace Team: Violence De-Escalation Skills Training

address_lines: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
Join us for an all-day training that will provide you with the skills and practice to help de-escalate violence, be a better marshal at protests and rallies, and even explore opportunities to join the Meta Peace Team as a regular volunteer. 

The Meta Peace Team has been training and deploying Peace Teams domestically and internationally since 1993.  They are currently sending teams to Palestine and the US Mexico Border, and are on call to be a calming presence to help prevent violence at protests and rallies.

This training has a suggested donation of $85 per person to compensate the Meta Peace Team trainers (more if you can help us cover lunch, less if you can't even afford the $85 - nobody will be turned away due to lack of funds) .  Crowded Table Coalition will be providing lunch, and will gladly accept any donations in excess of the $85 to cover that expense as well.

Description from Meta Peace Team (https://www.metapeaceteam.org/our-next-nonviolence-skills-training):

In this 8-hour workshop, participants will explore nonviolence in the "big picture"; what it means, how it is used, and how good-hearted, well-intentioned people can disagree yet still work together. You will learn and gain practice in specific skills and tools that are useful both in conflict intervention situations and in daily life, including:

- Active Listening
- The Importance of Body Language
- Personal Power Messages
- The CLARA technique

You will be introduced to tools for group work (Affinity Teams and consensus decision making) and to the concept of “peace teams” or third-party nonviolent intervention (TPNI) and its scope of possibilities, including Unarmed Civilian Protection (UCP). You will learn the finer points of compassionate Bystander Intervention.  And finally, you will learn about the work of MPT and how they can get involved if they want to.

title: Jennifer Adams Community Conversations: A Town Hall with a Purpose Monthly Event
description:
Join us for an exciting evening & town hall event with two fierce women for a major announcement! 

Hometown leaders Jennifer Adams & Gay Valimont -- two fighters & leaders who have overcome adversity & proven able to make a difference are thrilled to invite you to an inspiring & impactful evening to launch an exciting new initiative by these proven advocates for Florida’s families, freedoms & future.

📣 Join us for this month’s, “Community Conversation with Jennifer Adams: A Town Hall with a Purpose” event

We must ALL step up and do something to fight for our freedoms, families and futures now and for the generations to come!

Sign up, volunteer, follow Jennifer Adams on social media, participate virtually if unable to attend in person, and/or help spread the word about our next upcoming and free monthly “Community Conversation with Jennifer Adams: A Town Hall with a Purpose” event.

Jennifer’s monthly events are opportunities to hear all of our voices and together create a vision and plan of action to really solve the problems facing all of us in our communities.

We must ensure all of our voices are heard and do our part to help transform our vision into reality.

Event Details:
🗓 Tuesday, May 27th
🕛 6:30 PM – 8:30 PM
📍 Longwood Community Building, 200 W. Warren Avenue, Longwood, FL 

Cost: FREE!

ALL ARE WELCOME!

Make sure to save your seat & RSVP at the link below!

ℹ️ About Jennifer Adams
Jennifer Adams is a passionate and lifelong Floridian who grew up here and after overcoming abuse and a legal system that didn’t work to protect her or her kids, persevered to become an effective, service-minded advocate for our communities, collaborative policymaking, and a respected leader in the fight for those without a voice to find efficient solutions to the root causes of issues and do so with bipartisan support and public-private partnerships.

With years of experience working in serving on government and non-profit organizations, she has dedicated her life to empowering voices across our community. Jennifer believes that every individual, regardless of political affiliation, deserves to be heard.

Her commitment to uniting Floridians from all walks of life makes her the perfect host for this important conversation and commitment to the future of our community and the generations to come.

⁉️ Why Attend?
This is about more than just an event; it’s about our future! Join us as we stand together against the bullies and billionaires who often drown out the voices of everyday Americans.

This gathering will be a powerful reminder that we are all neighbors, coworkers, and part of the same community. Your voice matters, and together we can create meaningful change!

By participating in these Community Conversations, you’ll have the opportunity to:

- Share your thoughts and ideas on the challenges we face.

- Collaborate with fellow community members to develop strategic solutions and a collaborative plan of action.

- Stand up for a future where every voice—whether Republican, Independent, or Democrat is represented and valued.

🤝 Bring Your Friends!
Let’s amplify our impact!

Invite your friends, family, and neighbors who care about building a brighter community today for the future of all Floridians. The more diverse voices we bring to the table, the stronger our collective message and voices will be!

This evening promises to be both uplifting and transformative. Together, we have the power to create the future we deserve, lift each other up, and create a community where everyone’s voice is heard and represented.

💪🏻 Don’t miss out on this chance to make a difference—join us, and let’s take our stand together.

➡️ Sign up today!

We look forward to seeing you there!

In this together,

Friends of Florida’s 7th Congressional District
www.JenniferAdamsforCongress.com  

Donate: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/vote-jennifer-adams

@JenniferAdamsforFL #theunion
#itsgotime #JenniferAdams #FLCD7 #ElectionsMatter #community #strongertogether #leadershipmatters

Alliance San Diego and We Are CA are joining the California Teachers Association, and educators in San Diego for a statewide action to stand up for students and defend public education!

Dismantling the Department of Education, laying off thousands of dedicated department of education staff, appointing someone who has never spent a day teaching in a classroom to be our Secretary of Education…these are more than just headlines. They are direct threats to public education and the future of students and families across our community.

The Trump Administration is betraying public-school students and educators. Education is a non-partisan issue. Students in poverty and students with special needs deserve resources and support in our schools – we can all agree on that. The Trump Administration is targeting students and families in our communities with these vicious plans to dismantle public education. It’s unacceptable and we’re fighting back.

title: Save Our Say Sit In
description:
Respect MO Voters and 50501 Missouri invite you to our SAVE OUR SAY Sit-In at Park Central Square. As Missouri legislators return home after undermining voter-approved amendments, we will gather to demand that our voices be heard and respected.
For over a century, Missourians have relied on the citizen initiative process to shape our state's laws. That process is now under attack. In April, Governor Kehoe signed SB22, also known as the "Let Politicians Lie Act.” This bill guts the initiative process, making it nearly impossible for everyday citizens to put measures on the ballot without political interference.
We are rallying to protect our democracy and support a proposed 2026 amendment that would: 1-Ban politicians from overturning voter-approved amendments 2-Protect the initiative process from added barriers 3-Stop misleading ballot language that manipulates voters
Together, we will send a clear message: We, the people, have the final say.

Event Highlights
 ✨ Guest Speakers
✨ Petitions, voter registration, calls & letters
✨ “Hands Around the Square”– Circle of Unity
✨ Family-friendly and peaceful

Bring: Signs, voice, water, snacks, chair/blanket, and comfortable shoes.

title: IMPEACH. CONVICT. REMOVE.

address_lines: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
_Demand Accountability. Defend Democracy._

**IMPEACH. CONVICT. REMOVE.**

The time has come to hold power accountable. That thing and his regime have shown a complete disregard for the very principles that our nation was built upon. From undermining democratic institutions to manipulating power for personal gain, their actions have eroded the core values of our Republic. We cannot, and will not, allow these abuses to go unchallenged.

**Impeach:** We demand that those who hold positions of power—especially the highest office in the land—are held accountable for their actions. We call for the impeachment of DonOld (t)Rump for his violations of the Constitution, his attacks on democratic norms, and his relentless attempts to obstruct justice.


**Convict:** An impeachment without conviction is only a partial victory. To restore the integrity of our democracy, we must ensure that justice is served. (t)Rump’s actions have shown a flagrant disregard for the rule of law, and he must be convicted for his abuse of power.


**Remove:** The ultimate goal is the removal of DonOld (t)Rump from office. A 'leader' who has shown such blatant corruption, disregard for human rights, and contempt for our democracy does not deserve to lead this nation any longer. It’s time to remove him from power and restore the people's faith in our government.

This protest is not just about one person, but about the very future of our democracy. Every abuse of power, every instance of corruption, and every attempt to silence dissent is a step toward the erosion of our freedoms. By standing together, we send a clear message that we will not allow those in power to act above the law.

**Why We Must Act _Now_:**

- The longer we allow corruption and power abuse to go unchecked, the more entrenched it becomes.
- Democracy is fragile, and it is our duty to protect it. History will judge us by what we do in these crucial moments.
- If we fail to demand accountability now, we risk paving the way for future leaders to follow in Trump's footsteps and further undermine the principles of justice and democracy.

The fight for justice is not easy, but it is **necessary.** This is our moment to act—for the future of our nation, for our children, and for the preservation of democracy itself.

title: Public Service Commission: Postcard Party!
description:
In 2025, we need to stand up to Georgia Power and monopolies on our energy that make our bills higher! 

We'll use an app that will help you find your friends who are registered to vote. GA WFP will send those friends a mailed postcard with your photo on it (to really grab their attention), as well as info on what's at stake and a reminder to vote in the June primary for Public Service Commission!

title: Juneteenth Festival in the Park
description:
Juneteenth Volunteer Heroes are needed to sign up for shifts to host the McDowell Democrats' booth at the Festival in the Park on June 21.  
West Marion Community Park, 201 Ridley St., Marion Festival hours 4-8 p.m. Set up at 2 p.m., takedown at 8 p.m.

title: No Kings-National Day of Action Rally
description:
On June 14, from 11:00am- 1:30pm we will gather at the intersection of US-1 & SR-520, Cocoa, FL to remind Trump and his enablers: America has No King!
🔘Please bring your own beverages & signs.
🔘There will be some signs, sign making materials & water provided.
🔘Feel free to dress in costumes.
🔘Music & street theater throughout gathering.
🔘This is a Peaceful gathering. Please ignore any distractors, use crosswalks, & stay on sidewalks. There will be safety people in vests on all 4 corners.
‼️➡️Since many food pantries & shelters are taking financial hits, WE ARE DOING A FOOD & SUPPLIES DRIVE on the SW corner-
If you're able, please bring non-perishable food, blankets, socks, etc. to donate.⬅️‼️
Donald Trump thinks his rule is absolute, but in America, we don’t do “kings.” Since the inauguration, the Trump administration and its enablers have operated as though they have a mandate—but they don’t, and never did. They are going to extremes to empower Trump and enrich themselves, while cutting jobs and services for the rest of us. Now, they’re turning Flag Day into a celebration of Trump.
💰 He’s using OUR tax dollars to pay for HIS party: Donald Trump’s birthday celebration is expected to cost millions of our tax dollars, all while Republicans claim there’s no money for Social Security, SNAP, or Medicaid.
👑 We are united against kings: Trump has already indicated that he’s aiming for at least a third term, and now he’s planning a self-aggrandizing military parade in D.C But the American people don’t put up with kings. Together, we will mobilize in huge numbers to reject this corruption and abuse of power—it’s in our DNA as a country.
✋ They’ve gone too far: This is bigger than political disagreement. They’ve defied our courts, deported American citizens, disappeared people off the streets, and slashed our services—all while orchestrating a massive giveaway to their billionaire allies. Enough is enough. For anyone who thinks he’s gone too far, this movement is for you.
We’re standing together against the abuses of power, cruelty, and corruption.
When clowns 🤡 are elected, expect a circus 🎪 -
America 🇺🇸 has No King! 👑
